results.title: All about Eve
results.creator_credit: Vincent Burke, TopShelf Productions and Monique Oomen
results.brief_description: The powerful and moving story of Eve van Grafthorst who died of AIDS at the age of 11 in November 1993. Born 3 months premature, Eve contracted HIV through a blood transfusion to save her life. This documentary is a tribute to an extraordinary child who was determined to tell her story, her perspective on life, death, love, friends, family, AIDS and God. The film includes archival footage and reflects Eve’s constant battle against the disease, the prejudices associated with AIDS and of her constant drive to educate the public and support her friends with AIDS.

results.title: All about Bobby
results.creator_credit: Brad Stanley and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: Clearly, no one knows about twelve-year-old Bobby Ramirez, although each person questioned has their own opinion and impression of the boy. All of those impressions, and others are voice over film clips which show him going about his regular activities and refuting right and left views of the people who think they know him. A stimulating film which leads to an investigation into what and who each of us is.

results.title: All about Aichi
results.brief_description: An overview of Aichi, a state of Japan. Aspects of Aichi that are highlighted by this film include population size, industrial operations, educational institutions and the local crafts of the different towns.

results.title: Alkali metals
results.brief_description: Describes a number of properties shared by lithium, sodium and potassium: the soft silvery nature of these metals, their ready reaction with air, water and chlorine and the solubility of their salts.
results.description: Describes a number of properties shared by lithium, sodium and potassium: the soft silvery nature of these metals, their ready reaction with air, water and chlorine and the solubility of their salts.

results.title: Alive via satellite
results.brief_description: By international agreement, the Federal Seasafety Centre in Canberra is responsible for search and rescue over an area covering one-ninth of the earth’s oceans. It’s an enormous undertaking - keeping watch for those in peril on the sea over 20 million square kilometres of ocean and 37000 kilometres of coastline. Now space age technology is lending a helping hand. The Cospas/Sarsat International Search and Rescue System uses four space satellites to keep a constant and precise lookout for emergency position indicating radio beacons (EPIRB) and this video explains how this system works.

results.title: Alimentary tract
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Intended as a supplement to Digestion of foods, this film treats in detail, motility phenomena of the gastro-intestinal tract. Actual photography reveals different types of movements in the stomach, such as hypermotility, inhibition, antiperistalsis, hunger contractions and normal movements.

results.title: Alice Moyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: on music”.
Alice Moyle was born in South Africa on 25th December 1908 and spent her first four years there before migrating out to Australia with her parents. She learned the piano and studied music at school, attending the University of Melbourne Conservatorium where she graduated with a Bachelor of Music in 1930. Alice Moyle’s first experience of Aboriginal music was listening to recordings made by Professor Elkin when she was attending courses at the Faculty of Music at Sydney University. These recordings were to prepare teachers for work in the outback. In 1959 Alice made the first of many field trips into the outback to continue the process of recording and archiving Aboriginal music. She has continually tried to inspire others with her experiences and knowledge in Aboriginal music and culture and is adamant that music be included as an essential component in the study of Aboriginal culture. This documentary is a recorded interview between Alice Moyle and James Murdoch.

results.title: Alice in blunderland
results.creator_credit: Road Safety Council of New South Wales and W M. Moloney
results.brief_description: Road safety film made in Sydney using a parallel with the Alice in Wonderland fairytale to discuss issues of pedestrian and driver safety. Focusses on Alice who is more intent on her shopping than on paying attention to the traffic. She meets up with her boyfriend, “The Mad Hatter” and they go for a drive in the country and demonstrate the dangers of admiring the scenery instead of the road. Gives statistics comparing road deaths in NSW with WWII casualties. Features flashback footage of Sydney in 1908.
